Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is most similar (67.65%) torattlesnake Crotalicidin.   K: 43%; V=F: 13%. GRAVY: -0.44; M Wt: 2849.707; M formula: C139H242N36O25S1, mol ex coeff: 0.Activity: active against E. coli TOP10 or clinical strain (MIC 0.70 uM), S. aureus ATCC6538 or clinical strain (MIC 1.40 uM), P. aeruginosa or clinical strain (MIC 1.40 uM), S. saprophyticus ATCC BAA-750 (MIC 0.70 uM), S. typhymurium ATCC 14028 (MIC 0.70 uM), and  E. casseliflavus ATCC 700327 (MIC 0.70 uM).Toxicity: rat RBC: less than 2% hemolysis at 50 uM. HEK293 cells (IC50 ~60 uM).Structure:  predicted to be amphipathic helix.Upated 6/2024
Literature Information.Author: Hernández-Arvizu, E.E.; Silis-Moreno, T.M.; GarcíaArredondo, J.A.; Rodríguez-Torres, A.; Cervantes-Chávez, J.A.; Mosqueda, J. 2023
Literature Information.Title: Aquiluscidin, a Cathelicidin from Crotalus aquilus, and the Vcn-23 Derivative Peptide, Have Anti-Microbial Activity against Gram-Negative and Gram-Positive Bacteria
